title: Structured Decision Analysis
content: When time permits, structured analysis improves decision quality. Define the problem clearly, identify options, evaluate each against criteria, choose, and implement. This analytical approach catches assumptions, considers alternatives, and creates defensible reasoning. Use it when stakes are high and time allows.

mcq.question: When is structured decision analysis most appropriate?

options.B: For high-stakes decisions with adequate time available
options.D: When you don't know what to do

mcq.explanation: Structured analysis takes time but improves quality. Use it when stakes justify the investment and time permits. Don't use it when rapid action is required.

openQuestions: What high-stakes decisions do you face that would benefit from more structured analysis?
How do you determine when you have enough time for thorough analysis?
